alert.note: Alert for Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 30 at 7:44AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Greenville County in Upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 945 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 739 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rainfall of 1 to 2 inches over the past 6 hours due to showers and thunderstorms over the Reedy River and associated headwaters areas. The rain is tapering off, but additional amounts up to one-quarter inch will be possible through 9 am. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area as runoff of the earlier rainfall continues. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville Downtown and West Greenville. Flooding will develop along the Reedy River at Hudson Street. Bankfull will be exceeded along the Swamp Rabbit Trail, with flooding of low-lying areas expected. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
